description.narrative:
Saferworld will implement a programme of work to support and provide oversight of the process of democratisation in Somaliland leading up to the Parliamentary and Presidential elections planned for 2015. This action builds on interventions during earlier elections in Somaliland.
Saferworld proposes to work with the Somaliland Non-State Actors Forum (SONSAF) to provide critical civil society oversight of the electoral process. This will be done by reconvening and deepening the Somaliland Civil Society Election Forum (SCISEF) to provide a space for ongoing advocacy and oversight on key democratisation issues to support peace and stability. The SCISEF forum will prioritize issues internally but these are likely to include monitoring the progress of the election timetable, governmentspending on the elections, the context for early indications of political violence, election related legislation, needs and gaps inbroader support to the election process (i.e. voter education, political party training, and the international mission) and the extent to which media reporting is free, unbiased and conflict sensitive. It is important for them to hold early consultations on these issues so that they can produce an in-depth pre-election report which will set out a number of recommendations which will be used to advocate with key stakeholders. A final election report will analyse the results of the observer missions alongside a qualitative assessment of whether the election was free and fair and recommendations as to how democratisation can be strengthened in future elections.
The overall objective is to contribute towards Somaliland’s ongoing process of democratization and the holding of peaceful elections.
The specific objective of the project is to promote a transparent electoral process in Somaliland which is representative of a broad range of civil society concerns.
The expected outcomes/results are twofold: Result 1: Civil society is able to develop consensus-based positions and positively influence the Somaliland authorities and key members of the international community on issues relating to democratisation. SCISEF will be entirely focused on election related issues and are not expected to address non-related democratisation issues. However, SONSAF can choose to take these up under separately funded projects. This result will be measured by: a. Election-mandated institutions response to CSO policy recommendations in the pre-election period. b. Level of coordination and collaboration on priority election issues by civil society demonstrated by: 10 civil society policy positions on priority pre& post-election issues developed and disseminated by SCISEF based on consultation across all regions.
Result 2: Civil society provides oversight and reports on key issues in the Somaliland democratisation process (including voter registration).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
